testcase.name: DEC-V1-TC-LANGUAGE CAT
testcase.summary:
Decidim sites are multilanguage.

There must be a pop-down menu in the upper part of the site to switch languages.

By default there are three languages: catalan, castillano, english

This TC has to check out that the menu works correctly switching between the different languages and the selected languages stays actives even if you navigate to another page.
testcase.preconditions:
A decidim site has to be no-line.

Use http://staging.decidim.codegram.com/

step.actions: access the site decidim
step.expectedresults: the site is online and fully loaded

step.actions: hover to the language pop-down menu
step.expectedresults: the pop-dowm menu appears and display the other languages

step.actions: clic on the catalan option
step.expectedresults: the language selected must be visible in the top part of the site when the pop-down menu dissapears

step.actions: assert that the top menu is in catalan
step.expectedresults:
the top menu must have at least the following options:

  1. inici
  2. processos
  3. assemblees
  4. més informació

step.actions:
assert that the following pages are in catalan:

  1. inici
  2. processos
  3. assemblees
  4. més informació
step.expectedresults: Each Page must hav catalan text

step.actions: Return to home page and assert that is in catalan
step.expectedresults: the language menu must be in catalan and the text must be catalan

Decidim offers several methods for allowing participants to get authorization to perform certain privileged actions. This module implements several of those methods and also offers a way for installation to implement their custom verification methods.

Each decidim instance is in full control of its authorizations, and can customize:

  • The different methods to be used by users to get verified. For example, through a census, by uploading their identity documents, or by receiving a verification home at their address.

  • The different actions in decidim that require authorization, and which authorization method they require. For example, a decidim instance might choose to require census authorization to create proposals, but a fully verified address via a verification code sent by postal mail for voting on proposals.

 

Decidim implements two type of authorization methods:

  • Form authorizations.

    When your verification method is simple enough, you can use a Rectify::Form to implement it. "Simple" here means that the authorization can be granted with the submission of a single form. For example, to validate a user against a census API you will need a form with some fields that your users will use to authenticate against a census (for example, an ID and a Postal Code)

  • Workflow authorizations.

    For more complex scenarios requiring several steps or admin intervention, you can register a verification flow.

Custom action authorizers

Custom action authorizers are an advanced component that can be used in both types of authorization methods to customize some parts of the authorization process. These are particulary useful when used within verification options, which are set in the admin zone related to a component action. As a result, a verification method will be allowed to change the authorization logic and the appearance based on the context where the authorization is being performed.

For example, you can require authorization for supporting proposals in a participatory process, and also restrict it to users with postal codes 12345 and 12346.

 

Detailed information:

https://github.com/decidim/decidim/tree/master/decidim-verifications

Authorization:

https://github.com/decidim/decidim/blob/master/decidim-verifications/spec/system/authorizations_spec.rb

Action Authorization:

https://github.com/decidim/decidim/blob/master/decidim-verifications/spec/system/action_authorization_spec.rb

Postal letter code authorization:

https://github.com/decidim/decidim/tree/master/decidim-verifications/spec/system/postal_letter

testcase.summary:
The home page is a sort of hub to the different areas ot the platform, a welcome page and a tool to obtain more information. It's a scrolling dowm page so we will go from top, which means right under the "top-menu" untill the web footer.

The first part is a HERO section. The Hero section is designed to create an eye-catching area,  that can contain a Logo, Title, Button and Block Section. It's basically a ready-made group of sections that work together with a background 'Hero' image that will look great on any device. It has a full screen fixed background that does not move when the displaY.

  1. an image

  3. a BUTTON with custom text

The text and the image are visible.

The BUTTON has a hover effect.

When clik the BUTTON links to a different page.

A welcome message.

A register button

A background image optional
